intro: Tetracera marquesii, commonly known as the Marquesas tetracera, is a flowering plant species native to the Marquesas Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure, typical of many species in its family. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal or lowland habitats. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
